comments.commentBody: The irony of trump's whole xenophobic trope is that in most cases, the Latinos were here before the white people. Lol. Just shows what idiots Trump attacks and that no one really wants to know the truth anyway. Sad.

Why are so many commentors bemoaning the option to read the article in Spanish? Why is that gimmicky or wrong? The BBC offers the option to readers to read their articles in over 30 languages, the NYT only three----chill out my fellow Americans, nearly 90% of the products you buy at Wal Mart were made in---China. Gasp--indeed.

I am sad to say, that Hispanics are apathetically uninterested in politics, and organize and come together with an unified voice.
There are not real Hispanic leaders to move the masses and organize the message, the pseudo leaders are self-appointed opportunists motivated by personal gain, they are ready to sell themselves for a cheesy new Trump suit , a tie and a few Trump steaks, and then spew their indigestion by warning America, that one day there is going to be a taco stand in every corner.
Any Hispanic for Trump needs to have their heads checked out.

replies.commentBody:
Yes, Si. I hope that Tim Kaine will speak in Spanish during the VP debate on Tuesday. He might refer to the Cuban - Trump connection and other matters.

Hasta la vista, Donald Trump!
======================

comments.commentBody: This is the time for Tim Kaine to pick up the ball if he hasn't already done so. If the Democrats aren't currently running ads on the Latino television and radio stations, they need to start. And they should also be encouraging Latino-Americans' use of YouTube videos and all the social media sites.

replies.commentBody: You forgot to add to your racist category, corporate welfare, specifically GW Bush's bailout of Wall Street's clowns to the tune of $700 BILLION. Facts are truly stubborn things.

comments.commentBody: Apologies to JFK - Ask not what you can do for this country, but ask what this country can do for your______ (insert minority or majority group you identify with here). Thank you NYT!

replies.commentBody: well said. Not PC, but well said.

The simple fact is the GOP has done everything possible to not overhaul immigration reform.  GW Bush tried it, and the GOP's leadership in Congress simply refused to move on it. Is immigration a mess? Yes. Does the GOP offer solutions? No. They simply want to load everyone on a bus and ship them back---an impossible logistical exercise. Look, when all immigrants can have the very same program Cuban immigrants receive, food stamps, free education, free housing, and a Green Card, then we will have a fair immigration policy, short of that, let's make all immigrants hew to one standard, period.

comments.commentBody:
If I were a one-issue voter, that issue would be ILLEGAL immigration and I would vote for The Donald. No ducking this issue!

But Trump is a disaster and Hillary is FAR more qualified to be President.

However, I must wonder how many Latinos who were originally ILLEGAL (or whose parents were) will be voting in this election and skewering the result on the basis of this one issue?

What a racist argument, in reverse: vote for unlimited immigration so that "the fastest-growing segments of the electorate" can continue to be so, so that we can avoid any limits on limiting immigration.

The only problem the Democrats have is failing to emphasize the ILLEGAL part unless the ILLEGAL part helps us with a specific sub-issue in the debate.

Chevy
South Hadley, MA

Hillary Clinton has repeatedly said said to be a very quick study. As she expected to be paired with Jeb Bush, fluent in Spanish, did Hillary ever make an effort to learn that language and so better have a grasp of the needs of its people?

NYT's "Leer en español" is a dumb little stunt, a cheap trick, not intended to be read by anyone, but making sure  readers understand that the US will be one day soon a bilingual country, and one therefore permanently ruled by Democrats.  Because the NYT knows that "the thoughts of those who are more comfortable using Spanish than English", as Citizen so delicately phrased it below, will not find their way to be expressed in English, Spanish or any other language in a NYT post.  Those people don't read the NYT, an elitist publication if there ever was one, whose only purpose in courting Spanish speakers is to increase the Democratic vote.  Of their real troubles and issues the NYT cares little.

The times seems to have no problem playing the race card when it fits the editorial board.

Speaking for the xenophobic racists, you know, the people who like virtually every other country on earth, want a say in who comes and gets to stay in their country, I find this insulting. The greatest wave of immigration, legal or illegal, in u.s. history has occurred since the 1965 immigration act. It was never meant to throw open our borders to any one and everyone who can get across the border ( not to mention the intentionally imported). This wave, which has been largely responsible for adding over 100 million people since 1970 (with as many as 200 million more by century's end), is having, and will continue to have far reaching effects, basically for ever. The environment, wilderness, education, loss of open space, global warming, everything, is going to be negatively affected by this casual, unstudied, un voted upon, change in demographics. We are well past any kind of sustainable population. Making the u.s. look like a third world country may give the PC crowd a warm fuzzy, but in the end, as we race to catch India and China (do we really want to have that many people?) we will regret being the population relief valve for the world. Sure, claim its racism, but the bottom line is, it won't matter if they're Hispanics or Swedish bikini team members when we hit 500 million. The real American Dream and life style will be gone.

I wish that the NYTimes and other liberal media would make election coverage access free until Election Day. This election is too important and wider access to real news and investigative articles is critical for the outcome of this election. The price of a NYTimes subscription may be too expensive for most middle and low income Americans who must register and turn out to vote.

I share my thoughts based on a single logic; I LOVE Humans! I want every child, without regard to skin color, religion, orientation or other divisions to have a great life in which to grow and bring greater joy to themselves, their family and our troubled world.

Mr. Trump has stated things unthinkable to a rational loving human being, insults to the Latin public seems to be a special treat to his mentally ill state of being.

Mrs. Clinton has stated things that allow for inclusions and acceptance of all people in a diverse America that includes lots of bridges and no racist walls.

So, though this is an article about the importance of the Hispanic public exercising its right and privilege to vote, I urge everyone with an idea of a better future for all Americans to not only go and vote but to insist that as many people as you can influence do go and exercise that vote privilege, your color, ethnicity or religion does not matter, this is THE year that your vote truly matters. Stop bigotry while we still can.

Peace to all

replies.commentBody:
Hi Ravi,

I think your Irish people have been picking United States governments without any Latino assistance , it is time that Latinos help in this matter.
Cheers mate.

comments.commentBody: The continent is 'Latino' all the way down from Mexico to the southern tip of Chile. All those countries are ruled by Latinos. Can someone tell me why some people are in a hurry to make sure why the government of United States is also picked by Latinos?

replies.commentBody: The plight of Jews during ww2 and the economic refugees of today is a false equivalence. Most people coming to the west now pass thru several safe countries before trying to get to the west. These countries do not provide a generous social safety net (the west does) and are therefore not on these migrants list. In this hemisphere Haitians, Cubans, Central Americans illustrate this perfectly. Obscuring the issue with emotional tugs at the heart does not help us address the issue. What should be done about millions of people who want a better life and should the west be responsible for providing it?

comments.commentBody: As a Jew preparing to celebrate the Jewish new year, I think of all the Jews who were murdered in the Holocaust and could not escape because of anti-immigrant sentiment.  Let's learn a little from history, please.  Desperate people immigrate illegally.  Have some compassion.  And vote for Hillary.

replies.commentBody: Your quibbling about details....what about the substance of the Editorial?

comments.commentBody:
I kinda feel sorry for the Editorial Board.

First, they think Latinos (whatever that term means) would be perusing the English language Sunday Times and suddenly be attracted by an editorial simultaneously printed in Spanish.

Second, they direct the Latinos reading the English language Times to the Spanish version of the editorial with "Leer en espanol (Read in Spanish)". Did the Editors think the Latinos who presumably can read Spanish did not understand the meaning of Leer en espanol?

Oh, Times, where have you gone? You are missed.

replies.commentBody: Read 538...New Mexico is lock for HRC

Most Latinos, have already heard about Johnson's comment of his admiration for Mexico's worst president after General Santa Ana, ex president Vicente Fox. The Mexican media is having hay day with him and described him as an incompetent loony.
A wasted vote for Johnson is a vote for Trump.

comments.commentBody:
NY Times readers might find it interesting that the latest polling in New Mexico shows Gov Gary Johnson, Libertarian, getting 31% of NM Hispanics, with many more expected on election day.

He was the governor of the most Hispanic state in the country and most Latinos love him.

In the same poll he is getting 42% of the Independents.

Not bad for someone whom the media thinks is nuts and reviles.

Juan Hernandez is his Hispanic outreach director, a real pro.

We expect to do well in every state with a large Mexican American population.
Other Latinos don't know him that well but that is rapidly changing.

With more than 75,000 volunteers in every state, this is the year of the Libertarians.

I hope that Tim Kaine will speak in Spanish during the VP debate on Tuesday. It would probably be a first for a debate to be translated into Spanish. And I hope there is a lot of talk about Trump's Cuban problem, at the debate...

Diversity helps all of us to get different opinions and perspectives on live so we can make wiser decisions, as a country and as people.

The only thing we have to fear is... Donald (Lying) Trump
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

The NYT as usual has once again only presented two (2) candidates namely Trump and Clinton.  It has left out the Green Party's candidate Dr. jill Stein who has great immigration platform for all immigrants. I happen to think that the NYT is so biased in approach to issues and candidates that it is doing a great disservice to all Americans.  Come on, how about free PR for Stein or some of the other 3rd Party candidates?  How about giving the nation a chance to be introduced to someone other than Clinton or Trump.

replies.commentBody: Gimmicky?  I found the Spanish translation ok to read, and an expression of good manners

comments.commentBody: Although my first language is Spanish, it is not surprising to find your editorial easier to follow in English. The Spanish version is not as coherent, perhaps because it seems out of context. Please remind your Editorial Board immigrants don't move to this country to make it look like the places that we left. Stop the gimmicky editorials, and go back to work.

Interesting to see that today's NYT is being read by lots of people, judging from the comments below, who are not often NYT readers and rarely make comments here. Was it the Trump tax headline, or just the immigration issue that got them worked up?

There are plenty of comments here from people who are apparently not Latino, but who claim to speak for Latinos, usually in a desperate effort to sell the Republican side.

I am not Latino. I am a pretty standard white Christian American with British Isle roots. But there are plenty of Latinos and part Latinos in my extended, multi-ethnic family. We discuss these matters, but I would never presume to speak for them. They are perfectly capable of making up their own minds.

The common conservative charge of "identity politics" is simply a shifty way of saying if you are not a white right winger you have no voice worth listening to.

After growing up in the Republican Party I washed my hands of it around 2005. The GOP is stuck in a ruinous ideology, and the more their ideology fails the more they double down on it, because the only thing it excels at is delivering monopoly wealth and power to a small, heedless oligarchy. Even the wealthy who profited from this ideology have in growing numbers begun to abandon it as too destructive to our country.

All voters can make a difference. This is one election where all the stay-at-home non-voters need to get out there and make their vote count. Given all that we know about Trump, there is no good future imaginable in which he wins the election. The election cannot come soon enough and we need to send this homunculus back to his cave in Florida or wherever.

replies.commentBody: Right on target, couldn't have been said better.

comments.commentBody: Just Sayin’: In your Sunday Review front page the name Trump appears 4 times. Re Latino Voters, you could have said: A big turnout could help Hillary Clinton’s campaign. In this way you are doing exactly what the great manipulator wants: his name/face ad nausea no matter what.
The newspaper that doesn't hire Latinos wants them to vote for the candidate who ignored them until they became an opportunity for her to get elected.

replies.commentBody: Congratulations on your decision to vote!  Well done (and good choice).

comments.commentBody: This is my first time voting and I'm very excited. I'm exercising my right to choose the government I want, unlike in my own country of Mexico where the level of corruption makes a mockery of the word democracy. Given the options in this election, I am choosing to vote for Hillary Clinton. If Trump were even remotely sane, I could see the temptation his followers are grasping at - a change in government, in the way we are governed would be a good thing but he is not the person to handle that change. The thought of him and his ilk being in any way in charge of me or any aspect of my life fills me with dread. This is already a great country, with more than the worlds fair share of everything and any promise of making it greater is simply unachievable in the current global climate. It is what it is, people, let's just be grateful, kind and inclusive. See you at the polls!

replies.commentBody: Sure it could. Hillary just makes them legal. No muss, no fuss. Next time it'll be 30 million. after all, having laws or rules about immigration are racist.

comments.commentBody:
Illegal aliens CAN vote in US elections. Simply return to your country of origin, apply for legal entry into our country, go through the steps necessary to become a citizen -- just as all our naturalized (immigrant) citizens have done -- and then, after you are granted US citizenship, you can vote!

It could not be simpler.
